WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, December 30th, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 474.
(Extract.)
37. The sentence of the General Court Martial, "To be confined at hard labor, for the term of two years, at such place as the General Commanding may direct," and ordered to be carried into effect at the Dry Tortugas, Florida, as promulgated in General Orders, No. 26, Headquarters, Military District of Harper's Ferry, of November 27th, 1864, in the case of Private Henry Williams, 1st Independent Kentucky Battery, is approved, except that the Penitentiary at Albany, New York, is designated as the place of confinement, instead of the Dry Tortugas, Florida, to which place the prisoner will be sent under proper guard, without delay.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the necessary transportation.
By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

1 Indept Batty
War Department
Adjutant Generals Office
Washington Dec. 30. 1864
Townsend E D
A A G
Sentence of Court Martial in case of priv Hy Williams 1' Indt Ky. Batty approved and Penitientary at New Albany N Y. to be the place of confinement instead of Dry Tortugas. --
Recd A. G. O. Jany 6. 1865
